title: Soldier Field
summary: Soldier Field is an American football and soccer stadium located in the Near South Side of Chicago, Illinois, near Downtown Chicago. It opened in 1924 and is the home field of the Chicago Bears of the National Football League (NFL), who moved there in 1971, and Chicago Fire FC of Major League Soccer (MLS).[12][13] It has a football capacity of 61,500, and it is the oldest stadium in the NFL.
